scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Julian Hyman Photograph Collection consists of 128 color photographs of New York City, mainly Manhattan, taken between 1970 and 1995. The photographs include aerial views; images of construction, building facades, storefronts, and architectural details, including images of neglected and abandoned buildings; bridges and waterfront scenes; street scenes and street portraits; and views of the World Trade Center, Empire State Building, museums and galleries, and statuary. Most photographs are unidentified.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Julian Hyman (1925- ) is an internist and oncologist from New Jersey. He became interested in photography while working in Korea early in his medical career. After returning to the United States, he practiced medicine at St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital, and continued using his photography skills to capture snapshots of city life.

scopecontent.p: includes crowds of observers, a jogger with a Walkman, a man with a beer in a paper bag, lone figures by the waterfront, and a petanque player from the La Boule New Yorkaise Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: includes an image of the 1991 American Merchant Mariner's Memorial at Battery Park, which depicts three merchant seamen stranded on a sinking ship, calling for help and trying to reach the hand of one of their shipmates in the water below.
